intro: Leptocaulis inermis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Leptocaulis inermis is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in other areas with consistent water availability.
